text: In mathematics, a unimodular polynomial matrix is a square polynomial matrix whose inverse exists and is itself a polynomial matrix. Equivalently, a polynomial matrix A is unimodular if its determinant det(A) is a nonzero constant. == References == * * . == External links == * Polynomial matrix glossary at Polyx (A matlab toolbox) Category:Matrices Category:Polynomials
title: Unimodular polynomial matrix
